p: The novel Beta-CoV responsible for COVID-19, named “severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2” (SARS-CoV-2), may have some characteristics in common with MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV, representing a different species (viral lineage B) within the same genus [ 4]. Interestingly, only 40% of amino acids of SARS-CoV-2 coincide with those of Beta-CoVs linked to SARS [ 5].
